channel.title: production on Angelo Basile
channel.description: Recent content in production on Angelo Basile

item.title: Some challenges of bringing NLP models in production
item.description: Summary “As the machine learning (ML) community continues to accumulate years of experience with live systems, a wide-spread and uncomfortable trend has emerged: developing and deploying ML systems is relatively fast and cheap, but maintaining them over time is difficult and expensive”. (Sculley, et al., 2015) In this talk, we are going to take a look at some problems that arise when we are ready to bring NLP models to production.

item.title: Setting up a server for NLP models in production
item.description: Summary In machine learning, serving a trained model means making it available for people to use it to get predictions from their data and it is a fundamental step of bringing any NLP research outcome to production. Here we will see how to set up a high-performing inference server capable of running models saved in different formats. We will be using the TensorRT Inference Server (TRTIS from now on), developed by nvidia.
